Name: Kaitain
High Description: At the end of bidding, you may pay 2 spice per card to discard Treachery Cards from your hand.
Low Description: You only collect half (rounded up) of Treachery Card payments.
Occupied Description: Occupier collects the other half (rounded down) of Treachery Card payments you receive.

Name: Salusa Secundus
High Description: Your Sardaukar do not need spice to be counted as full strength.
Low Description: Your Sardaukar forces may not be revived for free.
Occupied Description: Your Sardaukar lose their Sardaukar advantage.

Name: Junction
High Description: You may offer to ship other factions cross-planet (half-price or full) as part of their Shipping action, even to or from homeworlds (including their own).
Low Description: You only collect half (rounded up) of shipping payments.
Occupied Description: The occupier collects the other half (rounded down) of shipping payments made by other players.

Name: Caladan
High Description: When you win a battle, you may add one force from your reserves to the territory or homeworld where the battle occurred as long as you have one force already there.
Low Description: You may not use your Movement advantage to peek at the next Spice blow.

Name: Richese
High Description: You may ship forces from your reserves along with a No-Field token.
Low Description: You may not move a No-Field Token.
Occupied Description: Occupier chooses which Richese Treachery Card is sold during bidding and gains half (rounded down) of payment you receive.

Name: Tleilax
High Description: When you take Free Revival, you may send those forces for free from your reserves to any one territory or homeworld, subject to storm and occupancy rules.
Low Description: If you start the Revival phase at low threshold, you do not collect spice when any other factions take free revival.
Occupied Description: You may not reveal Face Dancers against the occupier or their ally.

Name: Ix
High Description: When you pay to revive a Cyborg, you get 2 Suboids for free.
Low Description: You may not move the Hidden Mobile Stronghold
Occupied Description: Occupier takes control of your Bidding advantage.

Name: Tupile
High Description: You may not discard Worthless cards for spice (except by advanced Karama).
Low Description: Once per faction, when on another homeworld or if another faction is on Tupile, force that faction to tell you how much spice they have and the number of weapons or defenses they hold.
Occupied Description: Occupier and their ally’s hand size is increased by 1 (discard down to normal limit when not occupying Tupile), CHOAM lose their low-threshold advantage.

Name: Wallach Ix
High Description: When sending spiritual advisors to the Polar Sink as part of another faction’s shipment, you may send 2.
Low Description: You may not send spiritual advisors.
Occupied Description: Occupier and their ally are immune to the Voice.

Name: Ecaz
High Description: Gain 3 spice (from Spice Bank) each time a poison weapon is discarded.  Your alliance can win by co-occupying at least one stronghold and occupying two other factions’ homeworlds.
Low Description: When you and your ally are both in a battle with another faction, your opponent chooses which one of you fights the battle.
Occupied Description: Occupier or their ally gains Duke Vidal (and may revive him from the Tanks), overriding Ecaz and Moritani’s Duke Vidal advantage.

Name: Giedi Prime
High Description: Collect 2 spice from the Spice Bank if you collect spice from any desert territories or homeworlds during Spice Collection this turn.
Occupied Description: Occupier or their ally gains your extra free Treachery Card (if their hand is not full) when you buy Treachery Cards.

Name: Grumman
High Description: You may add a Terror token to a stronghold that already has one, or remove a Terror token from the board during Spice Collection, then gain 4 spice from the Spice Bank.
Low Description: You may not reveal a Terror token unless at least 3 forces enter the territory it is in.
Occupied Description: You may not reveal a Terror token when the occupier or their ally enters a territory contains one.

Name: Southern Hemisphere
High Description: Your starred “Fedaykin” forces may be placed immediately into any territory where you have forces when revived.
Occupied Description: Half (rounded down) of all spice you collect during Spice Collection is given to the occupier.
